text: I never thought I'd see the day when the whole world would be Rickrolled in unison.
We truly live in a strange era. On the bright side, it's been a while since I got Rickrolled, so it was kind of nostalgic.
Imagine being the one who pulled this off. Instant Internet legend status.
I wonder how many people were in the middle of something critical when they got Rickrolled.
I was working on a deadline, and I couldn't help but laugh when it happened. Talk about a "break" from work.
I was watching a SpaceX live stream. Rick Astley in space, now that's something new.
I've got to admit, this is one of the most impressive hacks in recent history.
As much as I hate to admit it, I'm kind of impressed. The sheer scale of the hack is something to marvel at.
Agreed, but it does raise some serious security concerns. If someone could do this with a harmless video, imagine what else they could do.
I'm just waiting for the post-mortem analysis on how this happened. It's going to be an interesting read for sure.
Yeah, I'm curious about the technical details behind this. Was it a DNS hijack, a massive BGP leak, or something else entirely?
I've got my popcorn ready. The security community is going to have a field day dissecting this one.
I came from 2040, just to say that this event will be remembered as a turning point in internet security.
Oh, and what exactly changes because of this event? Or is that classified information?
Let's just say that there's a bright future ahead for those working in cybersecurity. And Rick Astley's career gets a massive resurgence.
